search_results.title: US Stock Market Closes Higher as Investors Await Fed Decision
search_results.content: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 120 points, or 0.4%, to 34,560. The S&P 500 gained 0.5% to 4,530, and the NASDAQ Composite climbed 0.7% to 14,440. Investors are awaiting the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision, expected to be announced at 2 pm ET.

search_results.title: Federal Reserve Keeps Interest Rates Unchanged, Cites Economic Uncertainty
search_results.content: The Federal Reserve has decided to keep interest rates unchanged, citing ongoing economic uncertainty and inflation concerns. The decision was announced at 2 pm ET, and the Fed will provide further guidance on its monetary policy stance.

search_results.title: S&P 500 and NASDAQ Reach New Highs as Tech Stocks Surge
search_results.content: The S&P 500 and NASDAQ Composite have reached new highs, driven by a surge in tech stocks. The S&P 500 gained 1.2% to 4,550, while the NASDAQ Composite climbed 1.5% to 14,520. Apple, Amazon, and Microsoft were among the top performers.

search_results.title: Major Earnings Announcements: Apple, Amazon, and Microsoft Report Strong Results
search_results.content: Apple, Amazon, and Microsoft have reported strong earnings results, beating analyst expectations. Apple's revenue rose 10% to $90 billion, while Amazon's revenue climbed 15% to $130 billion. Microsoft's revenue gained 12% to $50 billion.

search_results.title: Economic Indicators: US GDP Growth Slows to 2.1% in Q2
search_results.content: The US GDP growth has slowed to 2.1% in the second quarter, down from 2.5% in the first quarter. The slowdown was driven by a decline in consumer spending and business investment.
